put.summary: Removes the given files and folders from trash.
put.description: Removes the given files and folders from trash. The files and folders will be deleted permanently.

200.description: If the operation is successfull, an empty response is returned.

requestBody.description: A JSON object describing the target files- and directories to delete.

put.description:
This request performs the synchronization of a single folder, resulting in different actions that should be
executed on the client afterwards. This action is typically executed as result of a `/drive?action=syncfolders`
request.

parameters.name: device
parameters.description: A friendly name identifying the client device from a user's point of view, e.g. "My Tablet PC".

parameters.name: diagnostics
parameters.description: If set to `true`, an additional diagnostics trace is supplied in the response.

parameters.name: quota
parameters.description: If set to `true`, additional quota information for the folder is supplied in the response.

parameters.name: columns
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of numeric column identifiers representing additional metadata that is relevant for the client. See [File metadata](#file-metadata). (deprecated, available until API version 2)

parameters.name: pushToken
parameters.description: The client's push registration token to associate it to generated events.

parameters.name: driveMeta
parameters.description: Controls the `.drive_meta` synchronization mode. `true`/`false` to forcibly enable or disable metadata synchronization for the request, or `inline` to include `.drive-meta`-data inside a corresponding `download` action as `data`-parameter. (available since v7.8.2)

200.description: A JSON object containing an array of actions the client should execute for synchronization. If the `diagnostics` parameter was set, quota  information was requested, or the supplied API version parameter is  equal or grater than 8, the array is wrapped into an additional JSON  object in the field `actions`. The path to the root folder is indicated in `pathToRoot`. If requested, the diagnostics trace is provided at  `diagnostics`, quota information at `quota`.  If `driveMeta` was set to `inline`, `download` actions for `.drive-meta`  will carry the metadata in an additional JSON object in `data` field  of `action`. In case of errors the responsible fields in the response  are filled.

requestBody.description:
A JSON object containing the fields `clientVersions` and `originalVersions`, both representing JSON arrays.
Since API version 2, the JSON object may also contain an array named `fileExclusions`.

put.summary: Uploads a file to the server.

parameters.name: newName
parameters.description: The target name of the file version to upload.

parameters.name: newChecksum
parameters.description: The target checksum of the file version to upload.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The previous name of the file version being uploaded. Only set when uploading an updated version of an existing file to the server.

parameters.name: checksum
parameters.description: The previous checksum of the file version to upload. Only set when uploading an updated version of an extsing file to the server.

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description: The content type of the file. If not defined, `application/octet-stream` is assumed.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The start offset in bytes for the upload when resuming a previous partial upload. If not defined, an offset of 0 is assumed.

parameters.name: totalLength
parameters.description: The total expected length of the file (required to support resume of uploads). If not defined, the upload is assumed completed after the operation.

parameters.name: created
parameters.description: The creation time of the file as timestamp.

parameters.name: modified
parameters.description: The last modification time of the file as timestamp. Defaults to the current server time if no value or a value larger than the current time is supplied.

parameters.name: device
parameters.description: A friendly name identifying the client device from a user's point of view, e.g. "My Tablet PC".

parameters.name: diagnostics
parameters.description: If set to `true`, an additional diagnostics trace is supplied in the response.

parameters.name: pushToken
parameters.description: The client's push registration token to associate it to generated events.

200.description:
A JSON object containing an array of actions the client should execute for synchronization. If the
`diagnostics` parameter was set, the array is wrapped into an additional JSON object in the field
`actions` and the diagnostics trace is provided at `diagnostics`. In case of errors the responsible
fields in the response are filled.

requestBody.description: The binary content of the file version to upload.

get.description:
Explicitly performs a move or rename operation for a file. 
This method is intended for the situation when no phsyical copy of the synchronized data is available on the client.

parameters.name: checksum
parameters.description: The checksum of the directory to update.

parameters.name: newPath
parameters.description: The new target path to apply, relative to the root folder.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the file version to update.

parameters.name: newName
parameters.description: The target name to apply.

200.description: An empty JSON object in case of a successful move. The client should perform the move operation locally afterwards, then enter a normal synchronization cycle to acknowledge any changes.

put.description:
This request performs the synchronization of all folders, resulting in different actions that should be
executed on the client afterwards. This operation typically serves as an entry point for a synchronization
cycle.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The current client version (matching the pattern `^[0-9]+(\\.[0-9]+)*$). If not set, the initial version 0 is assumed.

parameters.name: diagnostics
parameters.description: If set to `true`, an additional diagnostics trace is supplied in the response.

parameters.name: quota
parameters.description: If set to `true`, additional quota information for the folder is supplied in the response.

parameters.name: pushToken
parameters.description: The client's push registration token to associate it to generated events.

200.description:
A JSON object containing an array of actions the client should execute for synchronization. If the
`diagnostics` parameter was set, the array is wrapped into an additional JSON object in the field
`actions` and the diagnostics trace is provided at `diagnostics`. In case of errors the responsible
fields in the response are filled.

x-ox-examples.description: Example with error (not synchronizable root folder)

requestBody.description:
A JSON object containing the fields `clientVersions` and `originalVersions`, both representing JSON arrays.
Since API version 2, the JSON object may also contain two arrays named `fileExclusions` and `directoryExclusions`.

put.summary: Downloads a file from the server.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the file version to download.

parameters.name: checksum
parameters.description: The checksum of the file version to download.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The start offset in bytes for the download. If not defined, an offset of 0 is assumed.

parameters.name: length
parameters.description: The numer of bytes to include in the download stream. If not defined, the file is read until the end.

parameters.name: binary
parameters.description: Additional flag to prevent non-binary API responses during errors.

200.description: The binary content of the requested file version.

404.description: In case of the requested file was deleted or modified in the meantime.

500.description: In case of errors like missing parameters, etc.

x-ox-examples.example:
==> GET http://192.168.32.191/ajax/drive?action=download&root=56&path=/test2&name=Jellyfish.jpg&checksum=5a44c7ba5bbe4ec867233d67e4806848&offset=0&length=-1&session=5d0c1e8eb0964a3095438b450ff6810f

<== HTTP 200 OK (20.0011 ms elapsed, 775702 bytes received)

requestBody.description:
Optionally, available since API version 3, the request body can contain a JSON object with file- and/or
directory exclusion filters.

put.description:
Updates specific metadata of a synchronized file. This currently only includes the object permissions - which
in turn is only allowed for files marked as `shareable`.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the file version.

parameters.name: checksum
parameters.description: The checksum of the directory to update.

200.description:
An empty JSON object. Any transport warnings that occurred during sending the notifications are available in
the `warnings` field. In case of errors the responsible fields in the response are filled.

requestBody.description:
A JSON object containing the fields `file` and `notification`. The JSON object in field `file` describes
the updated file metadata (currently only the property `object_permissions` is considered) and the JSON object `notification`
may include a message to notify added permission entities. To notify with a default message, an empty `notification`
object should still be added.

get.summary: Gets all shared files and directories.
get.description: Gets all files and directories within the synchronized tree that are shared to others.

200.description:
A JSON object containing the fields `directories` and `files` with metadata objects of the shared items.
In case of errors the responsible fields in the response are filled.

get.description:
Explicitly performs a move or rename operation for a directory. 
This method is intended for the situation when no phsyical copy of the synchronized data is available on the client.

parameters.name: checksum
parameters.description: The checksum of the directory to update.

parameters.name: newPath
parameters.description: The new target path to apply, relative to the root folder.

200.description: An empty JSON object in case of a successful move. The client should perform the move operation locally afterwards, then enter a normal synchronization cycle to acknowledge any changes.

put.description: Deletes a previously created link for a file or folder. This action is only available for items marked as `shareable`.

200.description: A JSON object containing the (possibly) updated share target. In case of errors the corresponding fields in the response are filled.

requestBody.description: A JSON object describing the target file- or directory version to delete the link for.

put.summary: Gets file metadata (**deprecated, available until API version 2**).
put.description: Additional metadata of synchronized files is made available.

parameters.name: columns
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of numeric column identifiers representing additional metadata that is relevant for the client. See [File metadata](#file-metadata).

200.description:
A JSON object containing an array with file metadata in the order of the requested file versions. Each array
element describes one file metadata and is itself an array. The elements of each array contain the information
specified by the corresponding identifiers in the `columns` parameter. In case of errors the responsible fields
in the response are filled.

requestBody.description: A JSON array containing JSON objects representing the file versions to get metadata for. Each object in the array needs to be present in the referenced path.

get.summary: Gets various settings applicable for the drive client.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: The locale to use for language-sensitive setting (in the format `<2-letter-language>_<2-letter-regin>`, e.g. `de_CH` or `en_GB`). Defaults to the user's configured locale on the server.

200.description:
A JSON object holding the settings. This also includes a JSON array with the property name `quota` that
contains zero, one or two quota objects, depending on the filestore configuration. If one or more quota types
are missoing in the array, the client can expect that there are no limitations for that type. In case of
errors the responsible fields in the response are filled.

get.description:
Performs a "starts-with" search to find users, contacts and groups, e.g. to look up recipients when sharing a folder or item. 
Prior triggering the request, clients should check the user input against the configured value of minSearchChars received in the Settings request.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The query to search for (no need to include additional wildcards).

200.description:
A JSON array holding the found users, contacts and groups. 
Each element is an object as described in HTTP API (Extended Permission Object), without the "bits" property set. For external contacts, the fields "entity" and "type" are also not set.

get.description:
Registers a client device to receive push notifications from the server. The subscription is performed based on
the configured root folder ID of the client application that identifies itself with it's device token. Supported
services currently include the Apple Push Notification Service (APN) and Google Cloud Messaging (GCM). Trying
to perform an identical subscription (same `root`, `service`, and `token`) from the same user account again
is treated as a no-op.

parameters.name: service
parameters.description: The name of the underlying push service to use, currently one of gcm, apn, or apn.macos.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: The device's registration token as assigned by the service.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: The subscription mode supported by the client. If set to "separate", SYNC actions for directory versions where changes occurred will be returned if possible.

200.description: An empty JSON result. In case of errors the responsible fields in the response are filled.

put.description:
Registers a client device to receive push notifications from the server. Supported
services currently include the Apple Push Notification Service (APN) and Google Cloud Messaging (GCM). Trying
to perform an identical subscription from the same user account again
is treated as a no-op.

parameters.name: service
parameters.description: The name of the underlying push service to use, currently one of gcm, apn, or apn.macos.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: The device's registration token as assigned by the service.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: The subscription mode supported by the client. If set to "separate", SYNC actions for directory versions where changes occurred will be returned if possible.

200.description: An empty JSON result. In case of errors the responsible fields in the response are filled.

requestBody.description: A JSON object named root holding a JSON array of those root folder identifiers to subscribe to.

put.description: Updates a previously created link for a file or folder. This action is only available for items marked as `shareable`.

200.description:
A JSON object containing details about the share link, including its URL. In case of errors the responsible
fields in the response are filled.

requestBody.description: A JSON object containing the updated data of the share link as well as the share target. Only modified fields should be set.

put.description:
This request performs the selective synchronization of a single folder, resulting in different actions that should be
executed on the client afterwards.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The current client version (matching the pattern `^[0-9]+(\\.[0-9]+)*$). If not set, the initial version 0 is assumed.

parameters.name: diagnostics
parameters.description: If set to `true`, an additional diagnostics trace is supplied in the response.

parameters.name: quota
parameters.description: If set to `true`, additional quota information for the folder is supplied in the response.

parameters.name: pushToken
parameters.description: The client's push registration token to associate it to generated events.

200.description:
A JSON object containing an array of actions the client should execute for synchronization. If the
`diagnostics` parameter was set, the array is wrapped into an additional JSON object in the field
`actions` and the diagnostics trace is provided at `diagnostics`. In case of errors the responsible
fields in the response are filled.

requestBody.description:
A JSON object containing the fields `clientVersion` and `originalVersion` of the targeted directory. Optionally, 
the `fileExclusions` array may be defined.

get.summary: Gets statistics about the trash folder contents.
get.description:
Gets statistics about the trash folder contents. 
If a trash folder is available or not can be checked via hasTrashFolder received in the Settings request.

200.description:
A JSON object holding the recursively accumulated folder statistics. 
If no trash folder is available, an empty response is returned.

totalSize.description: The total size of the contents in bytes.

numFiles.description: The total number of contained files.

numFolders.description: The total number of contained folders.

get.description:
Allows getting a list of folders that are available on the server for synchronization. This request should be used to
build up a folder tree and let the user select the root synchronization folder(s).

parameters.name: parent
parameters.description: The ID of the parent folder to get the subfolders for as read from a previously fetched directory metadata object.

200.description:
A JSON object holding metadata information for all subfolders. The `files` array of the directory metadata
objects will be left out. In case of errors the responsible fields in the response are filled.

x-ox-examples.example:

get.description:
Listens for server-side changes. The request **blocks until new actions for the client are available, or the
specified waiting time elapses**. May return immediately if previously received but not yet processed actions
are available for this client.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: The maximum timeout in milliseconds to wait.

parameters.name: pushToken
parameters.description: The client's push registration token to associate it to generated events.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: The subscription mode supported by the client. If set to "separate", SYNC actions for directory versions where changes occurred will be returned if possible.

200.description:
A JSON object containing an array of actions the client should execute for synchronization. if no changes
were detected, an empty array is returned. Typically, the client will continue with the next `/drive?action=listen`
request after the response was processed. In case of errors the responsible fields in the response are filled.

put.description:
Listens for server-side changes on moultiple root folders. The request **blocks until new actions for the client are available, or the
specified waiting time elapses**. May return immediately if previously received but not yet processed actions
are available for this client.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: The maximum timeout in milliseconds to wait.

parameters.name: pushToken
parameters.description: The client's push registration token to associate it to generated events.

200.description:
A JSON array containing all actions the client should execute for synchronization. Each array element is an action as described in Actions. 
The relevant root folder identifier is available in the root parameter of the action. If there are no changes were detected, an empty array is returned. 
Typically, the client will continue with the next listen request after the response was processed.

requestBody.description: A JSON object named root holding a JSON array of those root folder identifiers to listen for changes in.

get.description:
Unregisters a previously registered client device to stop receiving push notifications from the server. The
same parameters that were used to perform the subscription need to be passed again, which includes the root
folder ID, the device token and the service name.

parameters.name: service
parameters.description: The name of the underlying push service to use, currently one of gcm, apn, or apn.macos.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: The device's registration token as assigned by the service.

200.description: An empty JSON result. In case of errors the responsible fields in the response are filled.

put.description: Unregisters a previously registered client device to stop receiving push notifications from the server.

parameters.name: service
parameters.description: The name of the underlying push service to use, currently one of gcm, apn, or apn.macos.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: The device's registration token as assigned by the service.

200.description: An empty JSON result. In case of errors the responsible fields in the response are filled.

requestBody.description: A JSON object named root holding a JSON array of those root folder identifiers to unsubscribe from.

put.summary: Notifies users or groups about a shared file or folder.
put.description: (Re-)Sends a share notification to one or more permission entities of a specific shared file or folder.

200.description:
An empty JSON object. Any transport warnings that occurred during sending the notifications are available in
the `warnings` field. In case of errors the responsible fields in the response are filled.

requestBody.description:
A JSON object describing the target file- or directory version to send the notification for. The entity IDs of
the recipients are listed in a JSON array named `entities`. Optionally, an additional JSON object `notification` may
be included, inside of which a custom `message` can be passed (otherwise, some default message is used).

put.description:
Creates a new or gets the previously created link for a file or folder that can be used to access the item in a browser
by anyone. This request is only available for items marked as `shareable`.

200.description:
A JSON object containing details about the share link, including its URL. In case of errors the responsible
fields in the response are filled.

x-ox-examples.description: Get the intial link for a file
Get an already existing link for a file

requestBody.description: A JSON object describing the target file- or directory version to get the link for.

get.summary: Retrieves the content of the trash folder
get.description: Retrieves the files and folders of the root level of the users trash folder.

200.description:
A JSON object holding the files and folders of the trash folder.
If no trash folder is available, an empty response is returned.

get.summary: Gets a direct link for a folder or a file into AppSuite.
get.description:
Generates a direct link into the AppSuite UI for a synchronized file or a synchronized folder and a
token for token-based login.

#### Use direct link and token with token-based login
`GET [redirectUrl]`

Login to AppSuite UI with token-based login via the link created with this request. Don't forget to append the `clientToken`
parameter with the value used to retrieve the redirect URL! Example: `GET http://localhost/appsuite#app=io.ox/editor&folder=273264&id=273264/307438&serverToken=7b90972628e34e89bb9a3946d1372c68&clientToken=47d74b1c-81df-11e4-b116-123b93f75cba`.

parameters.name: authId
parameters.description: Identifier for tracing every single login request passed between different systems in a cluster. The value should be some token that is unique for every login request.

parameters.name: clientToken
parameters.description: Client-side identifier for accessing the session later. The value should be some token that is unique for every login request.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the file in the synchronized folder given in `path` parameter.

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: The method of the jump. Available are: edit (opens the file in AppSuite editor or in text/spreadsheet if available), permissions (opens the file's/folder's change-permission dialog), version_history (opens the file's version history summary), preview (opens the file's/folder's preview). Defaults to preview.

200.description:
A JSON object containing the direct link to the file/folder including a server token for token based login.
In case of errors the responsible fields in the response are filled.

get.description: Updates a device's registration token in case a new one was assigned by the service.

parameters.name: service
parameters.description: The name of the underlying push service to use, currently one of gcm, apn, or apn.macos.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: The previous registration token as assigned by the service.

parameters.name: newToken
parameters.description: The new registration token as assigned by the service.

200.description: An empty JSON result. In case of errors the responsible fields in the response are filled.

get.summary: Gets metadata of a specific synchronized file.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the file version.

parameters.name: checksum
parameters.description: The checksum of the file version.

200.description: A JSON object containing the metadata of the requested file version. In case of errors the responsible fields in the response are filled.

put.description: Sends a notification message for a share link to one or more recipients.

200.description:
An empty JSON object. Any transport warnings that occurred during sending the notifications are available in
the `warnings` field. In case of errors the responsible fields in the response are filled.

requestBody.description:
A JSON object describing the target file- or directory version to send the link for. The recipients are listed
in field `recipients` and an optionally custom notification message may be specified in a `message` field.

get.summary: Gets directory metadata (**deprecated, available until API version 2**).
get.description: Additional metadata of synchronized directories is made available.

200.description:
A JSON object containing the fields `path`, `checksum`, `directLink`, and `directLinkFragments`. In case of errors
the responsible fields in the response are filled.

put.description:
Updates specific metadata of a synchronized directory. This currently only includes the permissions - which
in turn is only allowed for directories marked as `shareable`.

parameters.name: checksum
parameters.description: The checksum of the directory to update.

200.description:
An empty JSON object. Any transport warnings that occurred during sending the notifications are available in
the `warnings` field. In case of errors the responsible fields in the response are filled.

requestBody.description:
A JSON object containing the fields `folder` and `notification`. The JSON object in field `folder` describes
the updated directory metadata (currently only the property `permissions` is considered) and the JSON object `notification`
may include a message to notify added permission entities. To notify with a default message, an empty `notification`
object should still be added.

get.description:
Empties the trash folder, i.e. permanently removes any contained files and folders. 
If a trash folder is available or not can be checked via hasTrashFolder received in the Settings request.

200.description:
A JSON object holding the updated folder statistics after the trash was emptied.
If no trash folder is available, an empty response is returned.

totalSize.description: The total size of the contents in bytes.

numFiles.description: The total number of contained files.

numFolders.description: The total number of contained folders.

get.summary: Gets metadata of a specific synchronized directory.

parameters.name: checksum
parameters.description: The checksum of the directory.

200.description: A JSON object containing the metadata of the requested directory. In case of errors the responsible fields in the response are filled.

put.summary: Restores the given files and folders from trash.
put.description: Restores the given files and folders from trash. The files and folders are moved back to its original location if possible.

200.description: Returns the files and folders and their new paths.

requestBody.description: A JSON object describing the target files- and directories to restore.

get.summary: Gets quota limits and current usage.
get.description:
Gets the quota limits and current usage for the storage the supplied root folder belongs to. Depending on
the filestore configuration, this may include both restrictions on the number of allowed files and the total
size of all contained files in bytes. If there's no limit, -1 is returned.

200.description:
A JSON object containing a field `quota` that is an array of quota objects. The array size may be zero, one
or two, depending on the filestore configuration. If one or more quota types are missing in the array, the
client can expect that there are no limitations for that type. Besides the array, the JSON object also contains
a hyperlink behind the `manageLink` field, poiting to an URL where the user can manage his quota restrictions.
In case of errors the responsible fields in the response are filled.

error.description: The translated error message. Present in case of errors.

error_params.description: As of 7.4.2: Empty JSON array. Before that: Parameters for the error message that would need to be replaced in the error string (in a printf-format style).

error_id.description: Unique error identifier to help finding this error instance in the server logs.

error_desc.description: The technical error message (always English) useful for debugging the problem. Might be the same as error message if there is no more information available.

error_stack.description: If configured (see "com.openexchange.ajax.response.includeStackTraceOnError" in "server.properties") this field provides the stack trace of associated Java exception represented as a JSON array.

code.description: Error code consisting of an upper-case module identifier and a four-digit message number, separated by a dash; e.g. "MSG-0012"

categories.description: Either a single (String) or list (Array) of upper-case category identifiers to which the error belongs.

category.description: Maintained for legacy reasons: The numeric representation of the first category.

timestamp.description: The latest timestamp of the returned data.

DriveDirectoryVersion.description: A directory is uniquely identified by its full path, relative to the root folder, and the checksum of its content.

path.description: The path of the directory, including the directory's name, relative to the root folder, e.g. "/sub/test/letters."

checksum.description: The MD5 hash of the directory, expressed as a lowercase hexadecimal number string, 32 characters long, e.g. "f8cacac95379527cd4fa15f0cb782a09".

DriveFileVersion.description: A file in a directory is uniquely identified by its filename and the checksum of its content.

name.description: The name of the file, including its extension, e.g. "test.doc".

checksum.description: The MD5 hash of the file, expressed as a lowercase hexadecimal number string, 32 characters long, e.g. "f8cacac95379527cd4fa15f0cb782a09".

type.description: The pattern type, currently one of `exact` or `glob`, see [Pattern types](#pattern-types), too.

path.description: The path pattern, in a format depending on the pattern type.

name.description: The filename pattern, in a format depending on the pattern type.

caseSensitive.description: An optional flag to enable case-sensitive matching, defaults to `false`.

type.description: The pattern type, currently one of `exact` or `glob`, see [Pattern types](#pattern-types), too.

path.description: The path pattern, in a format depending on the pattern type.

caseSensitive.description: An optional flag to enable case-sensitive matching, defaults to `false`.

clientVersion.description: The client version of the directory to synchronize.

originalVersion.description: The previously synchronized and acknowledged version of the directoy.

fileExclusions.description: Defines client-side exclusion filters for files (since API version 2). See [Client side filtering](#client-side-filtering) for further information.

clientVersions.description: Lists all current directories below the root directory as a flat list.

originalVersions.description: Contains all previously known directories, i.e. all previously synchronized and acknowledged directories.

fileExclusions.description: Defines client-side exclusion filters for files (since API version 2). See [Client side filtering](#client-side-filtering) for further information.

directoryExclusions.description: Defines client-side exclusion filters for directories (since API version 2). See [Client side filtering](#client-side-filtering) for further information.

DriveSyncErrorData.description: The error data in case of synchronization errors.

error.description: The translated error message. Present in case of errors.

error_params.description: As of 7.4.2: Empty JSON array. Before that: Parameters for the error message that would need to be replaced in the error string (in a printf-format style).

error_id.description: Unique error identifier to help finding this error instance in the server logs.

error_desc.description: The technical error message (always English) useful for debugging the problem. Might be the same as error message if there is no more information available.

code.description: Error code consisting of an upper-case module identifier and a four-digit message number, separated by a dash; e.g. "DRV-0012"

categories.description: Either a single (String) or list (Array) of upper-case category identifiers to which the error belongs.

category.description: Maintained for legacy reasons: The numeric representation of the first category.

data.description: If `diagnostics` parameter is set, this is a JSON object with the fields `actions` (array of actions to execute), `diagnostics` (contains diagnostics trace), `pathToRoot`(Path to internal 'real' root folder from given rootFolderId)  and `quota`(quota limits and usage).

pathToRoot.description: Path to internal 'real' root folder from given rootFolderId

error.description: The translated error message. Present in case of errors.

error_params.description: As of 7.4.2: Empty JSON array. Before that: Parameters for the error message that would need to be replaced in the error string (in a printf-format style).

error_id.description: Unique error identifier to help finding this error instance in the server logs.

error_desc.description: The technical error message (always English) useful for debugging the problem. Might be the same as error message if there is no more information available.

error_stack.description: If configured (see "com.openexchange.ajax.response.includeStackTraceOnError" in "server.properties") this field provides the stack trace of associated Java exception represented as a JSON array.

code.description: Error code consisting of an upper-case module identifier and a four-digit message number, separated by a dash; e.g. "MSG-0012"

categories.description: Either a single (String) or list (Array) of upper-case category identifiers to which the error belongs.

category.description: Maintained for legacy reasons: The numeric representation of the first category.

timestamp.description: The latest timestamp of the returned data.

action.description: The type of action to execute, currently one of `acknowledge`, `edit`, `download`, `upload`, `remove`, `sync`, or `error`. See [Action types overview](#action-types-overview), too.

version.description: The (original) file- or directory-version referenced by the action. See [FileVersion](#/components/schemas/FileVersion) and [DirectoryVersion](#/components/schemas/DirectoryVersion) model.
version.title: Version

name.description: The name of the file. Only set for file versions.

checksum.description: The checksum of the file or folder.

path.description: The path of the folder. Only set for folder versions.

newVersion.title: NewVersion
newVersion.description: The (new) file- or directory-version referenced by the action. See [FileVersion](#/components/schemas/FileVersion) and [DirectoryVersion](#/components/schemas/DirectoryVersion) model.

name.description: The name of the file. Only set for file versions.

checksum.description: The checksum of the file or folder.

path.description: The path of the folder. Only set for folder versions.
The path to the synchronized folder, relative to the root folder.

offset.description: The requested start offset in bytes for file uploads.

totalLength.description: The total length in bytes for file downloads.

contentType.description: The file's content type for downloads (deprecated, available until API version 2).

created.description: The file's creation time (always UTC, not translated into user time).

modified.description: The file's last modification time (always UTC, not translated into user time).

quarantine.description: The flag to indicate whether the versions need to be excluded from synchronization.

noChunks.description: The flag to indicate that no partial uploads are possible due to missing support for temporary files.

reset.description: The flag to indicate whether locally stored checksums should be invalidated.

stop.description: The flag to signal that the client should stop the current synchronization cycle.

acknowledge.description: The flag to signal if the client should not update it's stored checksums when performing an `edit` action.

thumbnailLink.description: A direct link to a small thumbnail image of the file if available (deprecated, available until API version 2).

previewLink.description: A direct link to a medium-sized preview image of the file if available (deprecated, available until API version 2).

directLink.description: A direct link to the detail view of the file in the web interface (deprecated, available until API version 2).

directLinkFragments.description: The fragments part of the direct link (deprecated, available until API version 2).

data.description:
An array containing the actions the client should execute for synchronization.
For the case that diagnostics parameter is true another schema definition is needed. This case is currently not realizable with OpenAPI.

error.description: The translated error message. Present in case of errors.

error_params.description: As of 7.4.2: Empty JSON array. Before that: Parameters for the error message that would need to be replaced in the error string (in a printf-format style).

error_id.description: Unique error identifier to help finding this error instance in the server logs.

error_desc.description: The technical error message (always English) useful for debugging the problem. Might be the same as error message if there is no more information available.

error_stack.description: If configured (see "com.openexchange.ajax.response.includeStackTraceOnError" in "server.properties") this field provides the stack trace of associated Java exception represented as a JSON array.

code.description: Error code consisting of an upper-case module identifier and a four-digit message number, separated by a dash; e.g. "MSG-0012"

categories.description: Either a single (String) or list (Array) of upper-case category identifiers to which the error belongs.

category.description: Maintained for legacy reasons: The numeric representation of the first category.

timestamp.description: The latest timestamp of the returned data.

clientVersions.description: Lists all current files in the client directory.

originalVersions.description: Contains all previously known files, i.e. all previously synchronized and acknowledged files.

fileExclusions.description: Defines client-side exclusion filters for files (since API version 2). See [Client side filtering](#client-side-filtering) for further information.

bits.description: For non-mail folders, a number as described in [Permission flags](#permission-flags).

rights.description: For mail folders, the rights string as defined in [RFC 2086](http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2086).

identifier.description: The qualified identifier of the entity associated with this permission.

entity.description: Internal identifier of the user or group to which this permission applies (ignored for type "anonymous" or "guest").

group.description: Set `true` if entity refers to a group, `false` if it refers to a user (ignored for type "anonymous" or "guest").

type.description: The recipient type, i.e. one of "user", "group", "guest", "anonymous" (required if no internal "entity" defined).

password.description: An additional secret / pin number an anonymous user needs to enter when accessing the share (for type "anonymous", optional).

email_address.description: The e-mail address of the recipient (for type "guest").

display_name.description: The display name of the recipient (for type "guest", optional).

contact_id.description: The object identifier of the corresponding contact entry if the recipient was chosen from the address book (for type "guest", optional).

contact_folder.description: The folder identifier of the corresponding contact entry if the recipient was chosen from the address book (for type "guest", required if "contact_id" is set).

expiry_date.description: The end date / expiration time after which the share link is no longer accessible (for type "anonymous", optional).

identifier.description: The qualified identifier of the entity associated with this permission. Should be used to associate the entry  with its 'extended' permission version equivalent.

entity.description: Internal identifier of the permission entity (i.e. user-, group- or guest-ID).

bits.description: A number as described in [Permission flags](#permission-flags).

type.description: Set "user" for an internal user, "group" for a group, "guest" for a guest, or "anonymous" for an anonymous permission entity.

display_name.description: A display name for the permission entity.

contact.description: A (reduced) set of [Detailed contact data](#detailed-contact-data) for "user" and "guest" entities.

password.description: The optionally set password for "anonymous" entities.

expiry_date.description: The optionally set expiry date for "anonymous" entities.

includeSubfolders.description: The optionally set "include subfolders" option for "anonymous" entities.

isInherited.description: A flag indicating whether the permissions is inherited from the parent folder or not. The client must not allow the user to delete or update inherited permissions.

bits.description:
A number specifying the permission flags.
* 0 (the numerical value indicating no object permissions),
* 1 (the numerical value indicating read object permissions),
* 2 (the numerical value indicating write object permissions. This implicitly includes the “read” permission (this is no bitmask))

identifier.description: The qualified identifier of the entity associated with this permission.

entity.description: Internal identifier of the user or group to which this permission applies.

group.description: Is `true` if entity refers to a group, `false` if it refers to a user.

type.description: The recipient type, i.e. one of "user", "group", "guest", "anonymous" (required if no internal "entity" defined).

password.description: An additional secret / pin number an anonymous user needs to enter when accessing the share (for type "anonymous", optional).

email_address.description: The e-mail address of the recipient (for type "guest").

display_name.description: The display name of the recipient (for type "guest", optional).

contact_id.description: The object identifier of the corresponding contact entry if the recipient was chosen from the address book (for type "guest", optional).

contact_folder.description: The folder identifier of the corresponding contact entry if the recipient was chosen from the address book (for type "guest", required if "contact_id" is set).

expiry_date.description: The end date / expiration time after which the share link is no longer accessible (for type "anonymous", optional).

id.description: Object ID of the member's contact if the member is an existing contact.

folder_id.description: Parent folder ID of the member's contact if the member is an existing contact.

sort_name.description: A name which can be used for sorting.

mail.description: The email address (optional if you are referring to an internal contact).

mail_field.description:
Which email field of an existing contact (if any) is used for the mail field.
* 0 (independent contact),
* 1 (default email field, email1),
* 2 (second email field, email2),
* 3 (third email field, email3)

created_by.description: User ID of the user who created this object.

modified_by.description: User ID of the user who last modified this object.

last_modified.description: Date and time of the last modification.

folder_id.description: Object ID of the parent folder.

categories.description: String containing comma separated the categories. Order is preserved. Changing the order counts as modification of the object. Not present in folder objects.

private_flag.description: Overrides folder permissions in shared private folders: When `true`, this object is not visible to anyone except the owner. Not present in folder objects.

color_label.description: Color number used by Outlook to label the object. The assignment of colors to numbers is arbitrary and specified by the client. The numbers are integer numbers between 0 and 10 (inclusive). Not present in folder objects.

lastModifiedOfNewestAttachmentUTC.description: Timestamp of the newest attachment written with UTC time zone.

uid.description: Can only be written when the object is created. Internal and external globally unique identifier of the contact. Is used to recognize contacts within vCard files. If this attribute is not written it contains an automatic generated UUID.

street_home.description: The street of the home address.

postal_code_home.description: The postal code of the home address.

city_home.description: The city of the home address.

state_home.description: The state of the home address.

country_home.description: The country of the home address.

street_business.description: The street of the business address.

postal_code_business.description: The postal code of the business address.

city_business.description: The city of the business address.

state_business.description: The state of the business address.

country_business.description: The country of the business address.

postal_code_other.description: The postal code of another address.

image1_content_type.description: The content type of the image (like "image/png").

image_last_modified.description: The last modification of the image.

distribution_list.description: If this contact is a distribution list, then this field is an array of objects. Each object describes a member of the list.

number_of_distribution_list.description: The number of objects in the distribution list.

useCount.description: In case of sorting purposes the column 609 is also available, which places global address book contacts at the beginning of the result. If 609 is used, the order direction (ASC, DESC) is ignored.

yomiFirstName.description: Kana based representation for the First Name. Commonly used in japanese environments for searchin/sorting issues.

yomiLastName.description: Kana based representation for the Last Name. Commonly used in japanese environments for searchin/sorting issues.

yomiCompany.description: Kana based representation for the Company. Commonly used in japanese environments for searchin/sorting issues.

identifier.description: The qualified identifier of the entity associated with this permission. Should be used to associate the entry  with its 'extended' permission version equivalent.

entity.description: Internal identifier of the permission entity (i.e. user-, group- or guest-ID).

bits.description:
A number specifying the permission flags.
* 0 (the numerical value indicating no object permissions),
* 1 (the numerical value indicating read object permissions),
* 2 (the numerical value indicating write object permissions. This implicitly includes the “read” permission (this is no bitmask))

type.description: "user" for an internal user, "group" for a group, "guest" for a guest, or "anonymous" for an anonymous permission entity.

display_name.description: A display name for the permission entity.

password.description: The optionally set password for "anonymous" entities.

expiry_date.description: The optionally set expiry date for "anonymous" entities.

name.description: The name of the file version.

file_size.description: The file size of the version in bytes.

created.description: The file version's creation time (always UTC, not translated into user time).

modified.description: The file version's last modification time (always UTC, not translated into user time).

created_by.description: The ID of the user who created this object.

modified_by.description: The ID of the user who last modified this object.

version.description: The version identifier (usually, but not necessarily a numerical value) of the file version.

version_comment.description: An additional comment for the file version.

name.description: The name of the file the metadata belongs to.

checksum.description: The file's checksum. Only set if metadata is not retrieved through [Metadata synchronization](#metadata-synchronization) or via getTrashContent action.

path.description: The path of the parent directory. Only set if metadata is not retrieved through [Metadata synchronization](#metadata-synchronization) or via getTrashContent action.

created.description: The file's creation time (always UTC, not translated into user time).

modified.description: The file's last modification time (always UTC, not translated into user time).

created_by.description: The ID of the user who created this object.

modified_by.description: The ID of the user who last modified this object.

content_type.description: The content type of the file.

preview.description: A URL to a preview image for the file.

thumbnail.description: A URL to a thumbnail image for the file.

object_permissions.description: An array of all file permissions.

extended_object_permissions.description: An array of all file permissions including some additional information.

shared.description: `true` if the file is shared, `false` or not set, otherwise.

shareable.description: `true` if the file can be shared to others by the user, `false` or not set, otherwise.

locked.description: `true` if the file is locked, `false` or not set, otherwise.

jump.description: An array containing the names of possible `jump` methods to use for the file, like "preview", etc.

number_of_versions.description: The number of all versions of the file.

version.description: The current version identifier (usally, but not necessarily a numerical value) of the file.

version_comment.description: An additional comment for the file version.

versions.description: Metadata for all versions of the file.

id.description: The server-side unique identifier of the directory.

localized_name.description: The localized display name of the directory, if different from the physical name.

checksum.description: The directory's checksum. Only set if metadata is not retrieved through [Metadata synchronization](#metadata-synchronization).

own_rights.description: Folder permissions which apply to the current user, as described in OX HTTP API, Flags / bit masks.

permissions.description: An array of all folder permissions.

extended_permissions.description: An array of all folder permissions including some additional information.

default_folder.description: `true` if the folder is a default folder, `false` or not set, otherwise.

has_subfolders.description: `true` if the folder (potentially) has subfolders, `false` or not set, otherwise.

shared.description: `true` if the folder is shared, `false` or not set, otherwise.

shareable.description: `true` if the folder can be shared to others by the user, `false` or not set, otherwise.

not_synchronizable.description: `true` if the folder is excluded from synchronization, `false` or not set, otherwise.

type.description: The specifal folder type, or not set, if not available.

jump.description: An array containing the names of possible `jump` methods to use for the folder, like "permissions", etc.

files.description: Metadata for the contained files. Only set if metadata is retrieved through [Metadata synchronization](#metadata-synchronization).

action.description: The type of action to execute, currently one of `acknowledge`, `edit`, `download`, `upload`, `remove`, `sync`, or `error`. See [Action types overview](#action-types-overview), too.

version.description: The (original) file- or directory-version referenced by the action. See [FileVersion](#/components/schemas/FileVersion) and [DirectoryVersion](#/components/schemas/DirectoryVersion) model.

name.description: The name of the file. Only set for file versions.

checksum.description: The checksum of the file or folder.

path.description: The path of the folder. Only set for folder versions.

newVersion.title: NewVersion

checksum.description: The checksum of the file or folder.

path.description: The path of the folder. Only set for folder versions.
The path to the synchronized folder, relative to the root folder.

offset.description: The requested start offset in bytes for file uploads.

totalLength.description: The total length in bytes for file downloads.

contentType.description: The file's content type for downloads (deprecated, available until API version 2).

created.description: The file's creation time (always UTC, not translated into user time).

modified.description: The file's last modification time (always UTC, not translated into user time).

quarantine.description: The flag to indicate whether the versions need to be excluded from synchronization.

noChunks.description: The flag to indicate that no partial uploads are possible due to missing support for temporary files.

reset.description: The flag to indicate whether locally stored checksums should be invalidated.

stop.description: The flag to signal that the client should stop the current synchronization cycle.

acknowledge.description: The flag to signal if the client should not update it's stored checksums when performing an `edit` action.

thumbnailLink.description: A direct link to a small thumbnail image of the file if available (deprecated, available until API version 2).

previewLink.description: A direct link to a medium-sized preview image of the file if available (deprecated, available until API version 2).

directLink.description: A direct link to the detail view of the file in the web interface (deprecated, available until API version 2).

directLinkFragments.description: The fragments part of the direct link (deprecated, available until API version 2).

data.description: An array containing the actions the client should execute for synchronization. If the `diagnostics` parameter was set, quota  information was requested, or the supplied API version parameter is  equal or grater than 8, the array is wrapped into an additional JSON  object in the field `actions`. The path to the root folder is indicated in `pathToRoot`. If requested, the diagnostics trace is provided at  `diagnostics`, quota information at `quota`.  If `driveMeta` was set to `inline`, `download` actions for `.drive-meta`  will carry the metadata in an additional JSON object in `data` field  of `action`. In case of errors the responsible fields in the response  are filled. A JSON object containing an array of actions the client should execute for synchronization.

pathToRoot.description: Path to internal 'real' root folder from given rootFolderId

quota.description: An array of quota objects showing the quota limits and usage. A size of zero represents unlimited quota.

error.description: The translated error message. Present in case of errors.

error_params.description: As of 7.4.2: Empty JSON array. Before that: Parameters for the error message that would need to be replaced in the error string (in a printf-format style).

error_id.description: Unique error identifier to help finding this error instance in the server logs.

error_desc.description: The technical error message (always English) useful for debugging the problem. Might be the same as error message if there is no more information available.

error_stack.description: If configured (see "com.openexchange.ajax.response.includeStackTraceOnError" in "server.properties") this field provides the stack trace of associated Java exception represented as a JSON array.

code.description: Error code consisting of an upper-case module identifier and a four-digit message number, separated by a dash; e.g. "MSG-0012"

categories.description: Either a single (String) or list (Array) of upper-case category identifiers to which the error belongs.

category.description: Maintained for legacy reasons: The numeric representation of the first category.

timestamp.description: The latest timestamp of the returned data.

fileExclusions.description: Defines client-side exclusion filters for files (since API version 3). See [Client side filtering](#client-side-filtering) for further information.

directoryExclusions.description: Defines client-side exclusion filters for directories (since API version 3). See [Client side filtering](#client-side-filtering) for further information.

type.description: The kind of quota restriction, currently either `storage` (size of contained files in bytes) or `file` (number of files).

limit.description: The allowed limit (either number of files or sum of file sizes in bytes).

use.description: The current usage (again either number of files or sum of file sizes in bytes).

quota.description: An array of quota objects showing the quota limits and usage. A size of zero represents unlimited quota.

manageLink.description: A hyperlink that points to an URL where the user can manage his quota restrictions.

error.description: The translated error message. Present in case of errors.

error_params.description: As of 7.4.2: Empty JSON array. Before that: Parameters for the error message that would need to be replaced in the error string (in a printf-format style).

timestamp.description: The latest timestamp of the returned data.

quota.description: An array containing the quota restrictions. A size of zero represents unlimited quota.

quotaManageLink.description: A hyperlink to an URL where the user could manage his quota restrictions.

helpLink.description: A hyperlink to the online help.

supportedApiVersion.description: The API version suppirted by the server.

minApiVersion.description: The API version required to synchronize with the server.

localizedFolderNames.description:
A JSON object mapping the (relative) paths of directories to their localized name (based on the supplied `language` or the user's locale),
like `{"/Drive/My Files": "Meine Dateien"}` (available since v7.8.1).

capabilities.description: An array holding relevant capabilities of the user, like "invite_guests" (available since v7.8.1).

pathToRoot.description: Path to internal 'real' root folder from given rootFolderId

timestamp.description: The latest timestamp of the returned data.

redirectUrl.description: The direct link to the file/folder.

appendClientToken.description: `true` if the client token needs to be appended, `false`, otherwise.

error.description: The translated error message. Present in case of errors.

error_params.description: As of 7.4.2: Empty JSON array. Before that: Parameters for the error message that would need to be replaced in the error string (in a printf-format style).

error_id.description: Unique error identifier to help finding this error instance in the server logs.

error_desc.description: The technical error message (always English) useful for debugging the problem. Might be the same as error message if there is no more information available.

error_stack.description: If configured (see "com.openexchange.ajax.response.includeStackTraceOnError" in "server.properties") this field provides the stack trace of associated Java exception represented as a JSON array.

code.description: Error code consisting of an upper-case module identifier and a four-digit message number, separated by a dash; e.g. "MSG-0012"

categories.description: Either a single (String) or list (Array) of upper-case category identifiers to which the error belongs.

category.description: Maintained for legacy reasons: The numeric representation of the first category.

timestamp.description: The latest timestamp of the returned data.

data.description: An array containing the actions the client should execute for synchronization.

timestamp.description: The latest timestamp of the returned data.

name.description: The name of the file, including its extension, e.g. "test.doc". Not set if the target is a directory.

path.description: The path of the (file's parent) directory, relative to the root folder.

checksum.description: The MD5 hash of the file or directory, expressed as a lowercase hexadecimal number string, 32 characters long, e.g. "f8cacac95379527cd4fa15f0cb782a09".
The current checksum of the share target (available since v7.8.1).

entity.description: The identifier of the anonymous user entity for the share (read-only).

is_new.description: Whether the share link is new, i.e. it has been created by the `/share/management?action=getLink` request, or if it already existed (read-only).

expiry_date.description: The end date / expiration time after which the share link is no longer accessible.

password.description: An additional secret / pin number an anonymous user needs to enter when accessing the share.

includeSubfolders.description: An optional flag indicating if subfolders are included or not. Only applicable for shared infostore folders.

meta.description: Can be used by the client to save arbitrary JSON data along with the share.

entity.description: The identifier of the anonymous user entity for the share (read-only).

is_new.description: Whether the share link is new, i.e. it has been created by the `/share/management?action=getLink` request, or if it already existed (read-only).

expiry_date.description: The end date / expiration time after which the share link is no longer accessible.

password.description: An additional secret / pin number an anonymous user needs to enter when accessing the share.

includeSubfolders.description: An optional flag indicating if subfolders are included or not. Only applicable for shared infostore folders.

meta.description: Can be used by the client to save arbitrary JSON data along with the share.

recipients.description:
An array containing two-element JSON arrays specifying the recipients. The first element of a nested array
is the personal name, the second element is the email address. Missing address parts are represented by
`null` values. Example: `[["Otto Example", "otto@example.com"],["Horst Example", "horst@example.com"]`.

items.description: Describes one recipient, with its personal name as first element and the email address as second element.

transport.description: Can contain the transport mechanism to use, defaults to "mail".

message.description: A custom notification message, if not set some default message is used.

name.description: The name of the file, including its extension, e.g. "test.doc". Not set if the target is a directory.

path.description: The path of the (file's parent) directory, relative to the root folder.

checksum.description: The MD5 hash of the file or directory, expressed as a lowercase hexadecimal number string, 32 characters long, e.g. "f8cacac95379527cd4fa15f0cb782a09".

warnings.description: Can contain any transport warnings that occurred during sending the notifications.

gblQueryParamSession.name: session
gblQueryParamSession.description: A session ID previously obtained from the login module.

gblQueryParamRoot.name: root
gblQueryParamRoot.description: The ID of the referenced root folder on the server.

gblQueryParamPath.name: path
gblQueryParamPath.description: The path to the synchronized folder, relative to the root folder, starting with `/`.

gblQueryApiVersion.name: apiVersion
gblQueryApiVersion.description: The API version that the client is using. If not set, the initial version 0 is assumed.
